overview: The living sculpture Triglav was installed on 30 December 1968 in the centre of Ljubljana. The park was the location of numerous OHO actions and happenings in 1968. David Nez, Milenko Matanović and Drago Dellabernardina performed this action as a New Year gift to the citizens of Ljubljana. Triglav is the highest mountain in Slovenia and Slovene national symbol (it is also presented in the coat of arms of Slovenia). The work is pun on the mountain’s name that literally means ‘three-head’.
title: Triglav
